medium: Lacquer with gold and silver hiramaki-e and takamaki-e
title: Suzuribako (Writing Box)
text: Suzuribako, beautifully ornamented lacquer boxes with compartments for an ink stone, ink stick, water dropper, and brushes, became popular during the Muromachi period (1392-1573). By the Edo period, lacquer artists adroitly combined a variety of materials to produce sumptuous objects of great visual appeal. For this box, the waves and sea spray were rendered in silver, which has oxidized to a pewter-gray color. The moon, too, is a silver disk, and would have flashed brilliantly against the dark background sprinkled lightly with gold flakes.
description: Suauribako Writing Box, Tokugawa Period (1615-1868), c.1800; lacquer; A.Bottom; b. Lid; c. Ink holder tray; d. Silver butterfly; e.,f, Trays.
